results.title: Map reading: Benalla, Wangaratta, Tungamah
results.brief_description: RAAF training film contains aerial views of Benalla, Wangaratta, and Tungamah. Divided by black and white intertitles, the film shows (from the pilot’s perspective), the countryside approaching and leaving Benalla, Wangaratta, and Tungamah.

results.title: Maoriland movielogues. No. 12
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items including: 1. Tall timbers - Kauri forest, north Auckland, shows a 1200 year old tree and a sap gatherer climbing 52 feet up. 2. Dunedin - New Zealand’s Scottish city. Shows street scenes including trams and a cable car; domestic architecture and the Johnson quadruplets. 3. Ski land - action shots and ski instruction in one of New Zealand’s national parks. 4. Daffodil - springtime in central Otago. 5. Fiordland - Milford Sound including Sutherland Falls and memorial to explorer Clinton MacKinnon.

results.title: Maoriland movielogues. No. 10
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1.Rotorua Spa, New Zealand’s thermal spa. Scenes at the Sanatorium and Maori children diving for pennies. 2. Maoriland medley - in old New Zealand. To the accompaniment of Maori singing, sports, crafts and dancing are shown. 3. Rakiura, Stewart Island, New Zealand. Scenes and games on the holiday island. 4. Oddities - Moeraki Boulders, New Zealand. 5. Flying high over New Zealand’s southern alps. A flight of the RNZAF leaves Wighan Airfield, Christchurch for a flight over the Alps.

results.title: Maori village: a concert rehearsal near Rotarua
results.brief_description: Shows life in a typical Maori village; various customs of the Maoris; washing clothes in the hot pools; children at play; traditional costumes; concert party rehearse songs and dances; thermal activity; geysers and boiling springs.

results.title: Maori legends of New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Nicki Dennis, Conon Fraser, Martin Townsend and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Seven animated short stories based on the traditional spirit world of the Maori. 1. Pania of the reef 2. Maui catches the sun 3. Kuhukura’s net 4. Te hautaewa’s run 5. Rata and the canoe 6. Timirau’s pet whale 7. Rau Tapu’s magic feather. The seven programs would be best viewed separately as seven in a row is a bit of an overkill that causes dulling of the appreciation of the content.

results.title: Maori arts and culture. No. 1. Carving and decoration
results.creator_credit: Ronald Bowie, Cyril Morton, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Explains how the traditional Maori art of carving has been revived in New Zealand. Emphasises the creation of new forms in this ancient art by the use of modern materials and machines. Filmed at the Artifacts Dominion Museum, New Zealand.

results.title: Mao Tse Tung
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines Mao Tse Tung’s rise to power. It discusses the establishment of Communist rule in China, which led to a dramatic change of lifestyle for the Chinese people, and includes archival footage.

results.title: Mao's new suit
results.brief_description: Sally Ingleton’s documentary charts the fortunes of best friends Sun Jian and Guo Pei, as they prepare to stage their first designer collection in Shanghais annual Fashion Week. Their timing could not be more auspicious, Maoist austerity, the iron rice bowl and blue or grey tunics are out. For those too young to remember the Cultural Revolution, workers demonstrations have given way to makeup demonstrations. Matchmaking programs on TV and personal consultants are all the rage. This intriguing film captures the whirlwind pace of change in todays China.

results.title: Many Cultures-One Community
results.brief_description: This program looks at the dilemmas faced by many children, teenagers and adults, who are torn between a need to fit in with the Australian way of life and following the customs of their homeland. We meet the members of a Turkish family who share a wide range of problems including a teenage boy who wants to be accepted by his peers, his sister who wants to date boys and his parents who feel that he is ashamed of them and their culture. Issues raised include racism, multiculturalism and assimilation, name calling, the problems of living in a new country, the greater difficulties faced by women, peer group pressure, the generation gap and how migrant parents can cope.

results.title: Many classic moments
results.creator_credit: Gary Capo, James Sherman and Da Capo Films
results.brief_description: ‘Many Classic Moments’ explores the emotional surfing experience of some of the world’s best surfing talent, including Larry Bertleman, Michael Ho, Mark Liddell, Buttons Kaluhiokalani, James Jones and Dane Kealoha. The experiences are linked by their communication of the emotions that make up the thrill of surfing. The tape includes ‘Moments of fear’, ‘Moments of searching and finding’, ‘The Ultimate moment’, as well as a Surf Wars Cartoon.
